name: Corruption Conundrum
title: Struggling with Corruption Control
description: In 2023, Syria ranked in the 0.47th percentile for control of corruption, indicating significant challenges in governance and transparency.

name: Debt Dilemma
title: Minimal Debt Burden
description: Syria's total debt service was only 0.045% of GNI in 2022, reflecting a relatively low debt burden compared to global standards.

name: Consumption Collapse
title: Sharp Decline in Government Spending
description: In 2022, Syria experienced a drastic 49.4% decrease in government consumption expenditure, highlighting severe economic challenges.

name: Environmental Impact
title: High Carbon Damage Costs
description: In 2020, carbon dioxide damage accounted for 9.85% of Syria's GNI, indicating significant environmental challenges.

name: Youthful Nation
title: Young Population Dynamics
description: In 2023, 11.38% of the female population and 11.66% of the male population were aged 20-24, reflecting a youthful demographic.

name: Export Focus
title: Regional Trade Reliance
description: 58.07% of Syria's merchandise exports in 2023 were directed towards low- and middle-income economies in the Middle East & North Africa.

name: Educational Strain
title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Tertiary Education
description: In 2015, Syria had a pupil-teacher ratio of 64.4 in tertiary education, indicating potential challenges in educational quality.

name: Political Instability
title: Challenges in Political Stability
description: Syria's political stability estimate in 2023 was -2.75, reflecting ongoing issues with violence and governance.

name: Regulatory Challenges
title: Low Regulatory Quality
description: In 2023, Syria's regulatory quality was in the 0.47th percentile, indicating significant challenges in creating a conducive business environment.
